panels.title: Active Backend Connections
panels.description: Current number of backend connections to the PostgreSQL server. Monitor this to track database load and identify connection spikes.

panels.title: Maximum Connections Limit
panels.description: Configured maximum number of client connections allowed. Compare with active connections to ensure you're not approaching limits.

panels.title: Connection Utilization %
panels.description: Percentage of connections in use relative to the maximum allowed. High values (>80%) indicate potential connection exhaustion.

panels.title: Total Databases
panels.description: Total number of user databases in the PostgreSQL instance.

panels.title: Database Size
panels.description: Disk usage per database in bytes. Monitor growth trends and plan capacity.

panels.title: Buffer Cache Hit Ratio
panels.description: Percentage of disk blocks found in buffer cache vs read from disk. Values >99% indicate good cache performance.

panels.title: Blocks Read from Disk
panels.description: Rate of disk blocks read from disk per second. High values may indicate insufficient cache or heavy queries.

panels.title: Blocks Hit in Cache
panels.description: Rate of disk blocks found in buffer cache per second. Higher is better for performance.

panels.title: Total Block Reads by Source
panels.description: Distribution of block reads across different sources (heap, index, toast). Helps identify query patterns.

panels.title: Transaction Commit Rate
panels.description: Number of successful transaction commits per second. Indicates write workload.

panels.title: Transaction Rollback Rate
panels.description: Number of transaction rollbacks per second. High values may indicate application errors or conflicts.

panels.title: Commit Success Rate
panels.description: Percentage of transactions that commit successfully. Low values indicate potential issues.

panels.title: Rows Inserted
panels.description: Number of rows inserted per second across all databases.

panels.title: Rows Updated
panels.description: Number of rows updated per second across all databases.

panels.title: Rows Deleted
panels.description: Number of rows deleted per second across all databases.

panels.title: Rows Fetched
panels.description: Number of rows fetched by queries per second. Indicates read workload intensity.

panels.title: Rows Returned
panels.description: Number of rows returned by queries per second. High values may indicate inefficient queries.

panels.title: Database Operations by Type
panels.description: Breakdown of database row operations (insert, update, delete, hot update) by type.

panels.title: Table Count
panels.description: Total number of user tables per database.

panels.title: Table Size
Live Rows
panels.description: Number of live (active) rows in tables. Useful for understanding data volume.

panels.title: Dead Rows
panels.description: Number of dead rows waiting for vacuum. High values indicate need for vacuum tuning.

panels.title: Dead Row Percentage
panels.description: Percentage of dead rows vs total rows. Values >10% may impact performance.

panels.title: Index Scans
Index Size
panels.description: Size of indexes on disk in bytes. Monitor for bloat and optimization opportunities.

panels.title: Buffer Allocation Rate
panels.description: Rate of new buffers allocated per second by the background writer.

panels.title: Buffer Writes by Source
panels.description: Distribution of buffer writes across different sources (backend, checkpoints, bgwriter).

panels.title: Checkpoint Rate
panels.description: Number of checkpoints performed per second, split by type (scheduled vs requested).

panels.title: Checkpoint Duration
panels.description: Time spent in checkpoint operations (write and sync phases) in milliseconds.

panels.title: BgWriter Halt Events
panels.description: Times the background writer stopped due to writing too many buffers. Should be low.

panels.title: Manual Vacuum Rate
panels.description: Number of times tables have been manually vacuumed per second.

panels.title: Deadlock Rate
panels.description: Number of deadlocks detected per second. Should be zero or very low.

panels.title: Query Efficiency Ratio
panels.description: Ratio of rows fetched to rows returned. Values close to 1 indicate efficient queries.

panels.title: Write Activity Score
panels.description: Combined rate of all write operations (inserts + updates + deletes) per second.

panels.title: Database Health Score
panels.description: Composite health indicator based on cache hit ratio, commit success rate, and connection utilization.
